title: People complain about mobility...

embed.description: The Wandering Caretaker The celestial vagabond known only as Bard dwells beyond the physical universe in realms unknown to man. Manifesting when others threaten the cosmic equilibrium, the ancient caretaker acts with speed and intent, only returning to his endless watch once he has steered Runeterra from catastrophe.

body: So Riot makes a champion that gives everyone mobility. xD

Old* role, actually. Roamers used to be a thing before junglers were a hard requirement.

My main worry about his passive mobility is the randomness of it. It could really be a matter of live or die, and there's no telling when or where you might get

It's an interesting solution, but I'm concerned about the implications.  Many champions have previously been balanced around high-damage with low mobility.  Now you're going to have Annies, Warwicks, and the like dropping on your head from every which way.
Considering those champions have been left in the dust, I don't think this is a bad thing.

Wait, is his scaling even going to be low? (Herp derp)

Well he's got two damaging abilities, his passive and his Q, I expect he may have low initial damage on his passive with it scaling pretty high through the game.  His Q may not have high initial damage, but with it being able to hit two opponents, it could possibly add up.  It's possible that he could scale pretty hard in the right hands, though don't expect him to be going mid to burst people.

I want to see if he would be a good CC tanky jungler. His kit seems like it could work, but it would all come down to the numbers. With his stun for jungle camps, heals, passive so he can roam faster. His ganks would be great with his E and R. It obviously would come down to the early game and if he has the sustain/tankiness and damage to survive in it.
